alert.note: Alert for Humphreys; Sunflower (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 14 at 9:16PM CDT until June 15 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 PM CDT FOR SOUTHERN SUNFLOWER...NORTHEASTERN WASHINGTON AND NORTHWESTERN HUMPHREYS COUNTIES... At 915 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Holly Ridge to Tribbett to near Wayside, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. At 832 PM, trees were downed in Dermott. At 856 PM, a 48 MPH wind gust was measured at the Greenville Airport. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Tribbett and Holly Ridge around 920 PM CDT. Indianola around 925 PM CDT. Inverness around 930 PM CDT. Hollandale, Moorhead, Isola and Estill around 935 PM CDT. Darlove around 940 PM CDT. Belzoni around 945 PM CDT. Murphy around 950 PM CDT. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
